## üîç Quick Navigation

### For New Team Members
1. Start with [README.md](./README.md)
2. Review [AWS_INFRASTRUCTURE_DOCUMENTATION.md](./AWS_INFRASTRUCTURE_DOCUMENTATION.md)
3. Follow [DEPLOYMENT_MANUAL.md](./DEPLOYMENT_MANUAL.md)

### For Deployment
1. [DEPLOYMENT_MANUAL.md](./DEPLOYMENT_MANUAL.md) - Step-by-step guide
2. [UPGRADE_DEPLOYMENT_GUIDE.md](./UPGRADE_DEPLOYMENT_GUIDE.md) - For upgrades

### For Maintenance
1. [MAINTENANCE_GUIDE.md](./MAINTENANCE_GUIDE.md) - Regular tasks
2. [AWS_INFRASTRUCTURE_DOCUMENTATION.md](./AWS_INFRASTRUCTURE_DOCUMENTATION.md) - Resource reference

### For Development
1. [BACKEND_STRUCTURE.md](./backend/BACKEND_STRUCTURE.md) - Architecture
2. Scripts READMEs in respective directories

---

## üìù Documentation Standards

### Naming Convention
- `UPPERCASE_WITH_UNDERSCORES.md` - Major documentation
- `lowercase-with-dashes.md` - Minor or temporary docs
- `README.md` - Directory-specific guides

### Update Frequency
- **Core Documents**: Update with major changes
- **Technical Documents**: Update with implementation changes
- **Archived Documents**: Read-only, historical reference

### Version Control
- All documents tracked in Git
- Major updates should include date in document header
- Archive old versions before major rewrites
